intro: Haplodictyum, commonly known as the common hawksbeard, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow composite flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in a variety of habitats, including meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils. Haplodictyum species are often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural and urban environments.
